title: Way-too-early Grand Slam predictions for the rest of 2025
description: Madison Keys won her first Grand Slam and Jannik Sinner defended his Australian Open title. What does this mean for the rest of the year? We take a look.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: 'He's in a different universe right now': Jannik Sinner's dominance on display at Australian Open
description: Sinner won his second Australian Open title, cementing his place as the best in the world. Will he get only better from here?
author: Jake Michaels

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let‚Äôs take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Zverev returns in winning fashion, reaches Buenos Aires QFs
description: Competing for the first time since reaching the Australian Open final, Alexander Zverev returned in style Wednesday at the IEB+ Argentina Open in Buenos Aires. The top seed downed Serbian Dusan Lajovic 6-4, 6-4 to reach the quarter-finals at the ATP 250. Zverev was forced to work hard on serve at times, fighting through a four-deuce game at 4-3 in the second set, during which he was initially down a break. Lajovic disrupted the German‚Äôs rhythm by taking the ball early, but the German remained the more consistent player in key moments to seal a one-hour, 37-minute victory.The World No. 2 in the PIF ATP Rankings improved to 5-0 in his Lexus ATP Head2Head series with Lajovic. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm happy with my win today,‚Äù said Zverev, who won 80 per cent of his first-serve points, according to Infosys ATP Stats. ‚ÄúMaybe not the best match I‚Äôve played, but it‚Äôs great to get your first win on clay court‚Ä¶ The Argentines are very passionate, so it‚Äôs incredible to see a lot of people out for a first-round match. I‚Äôm enjoying myself and hopefully I‚Äôll play a lot more matches here.‚ÄùTop seed, top talent üëÜ@AlexZverev with the improvisation en route to 6-4 6-4 past Lajovic @ArgentinaOpen | #ArgOpen2025 pic.twitter.com/VlmNKkgXpZ‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) February 12, 2025 Up next for Zverev is the winner between the brotherly clash of Francisco Cerundolo and Juan Manuel Cerundolo. The 27-year-old Zverev tallied a 23-6 clay-court record in 2024, including a title run at the ATP Masters 1000 in Rome. He also made the Roland Garros and Hamburg finals. Zverev is competing in South America for the first time since 2014, when he was ranked outside the Top 800 and playing ATP Challenger Tour events.[NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Cer√∫ndolo brothers clash in Buenos Aires: 'Get the popcorn ready'
description: Francisco Cer√∫ndolo and Juan Manuel Cer√∫ndolo are much more than just a pair of tennis-playing brothers. With diametrically opposing personalities, the two brothers, who live under the same roof with their parents Alejandro and Mar√≠a Luz, and their sister, Constanza, have always been side-by-side in their journey through the world of tennis. On Wednesday, one of their shared dreams will come true when the two Argentines square off for a place in the quarter-finals of the IEB+ Argentina Open. After a rainy Tuesday and a delay of several hours, Juan Manuel took down Rom√°n Burruchaga after three and a half hours of tennis. Shortly thereafter, Francisco sealed the deal against Luciano Darderi, 6-4, 6-4. No sooner had the first Lexus ATP Head2Head encounter between the Argentine brothers been confirmed than the two took to social media with their immediate thoughts on the news. ‚ÄúPrepare the popcorn‚Äù, began Juan Manuel. Francisco responded: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know how many families can say that two brothers are playing each other in the last sixteen of a home ATP event. Tomorrow, whatever happens, we all win. Proud to play the night session at the Lawn Tennis Club.‚Äù However, after each of them had made their initial, more formal posts, the banter began: ‚ÄúNo getting wound up and bothering your opponent tomorrow!‚Äù began the younger brother Juan Manuel, to which the elder Francisco quickly replied: ‚ÄúRespect your elders, know your place!‚Äù Jokes aside, they agree that it will not be an easy match and that they would rather play any other opponent. Why? Humility and family empathy. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not great, I can‚Äôt lie, I hope that we can put on a show, that our parents don‚Äôt get too stressed and they can enjoy it. But I wouldn‚Äôt choose to play with my brother because one of us is going to lose,‚Äù said Francisco, the current No. 28 in the PIF ATP Rankings. Juan Manuel added with a smile: ‚ÄúWhen I got through qualifying and the draw came out, I didn‚Äôt like that I‚Äôd play him if I won, because it would be an uncomfortable match... If you win you feel a bit guilty, but at the same time, because he‚Äôs much better than me, I feel like I won‚Äôt feel anything. If he wins, he‚Äôll feel guilty.‚Äù The Cer√∫ndolo family lives and breathes tennis. They cannot imagine a life without racquets, racquet bags and tennis balls everywhere. The brothers‚Äô father, ‚ÄòToto‚Äô, coaches many Argentine players and reached No. 309 in the PIF ATP Rankings in 1982. ‚ÄúOur house is a locker room. We talk about sport, about tennis, all day. As parents, we never forced them into sport, or made them feel they had to be good,‚Äù Toto said. ‚ÄúWe brought them up with sport as a foundation for their lives and they each took their own path, which today makes us so proud.‚Äù [ATP APP] In the family structure, mum, Mar√≠a Luz, plays a fundamental role. Also a player, she later qualified as a psychologist specialising in sports and travels with her sons around the world as much as possible. The Cer√∫ndolo‚Äôs mother keeps their feet on the ground and brings harmony to the family unit. Francisco explained that his brother taught him to be more professional. ‚ÄúWhen he won the tournament in C√≥rdoba in 2021 and I reached the final in Buenos Aires in the next one, both at the same time, it was incredible for us... That‚Äôs where I think we believed we could make it on Tour,‚Äù ‚ÄòFran‚Äô said a couple of years ago. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs always wanted to do everything perfectly since he was small and I learned so much, from nutrition to training better... I found it hard when I was younger, I was pretty lazy and I learned to be disciplined from him, and it shows in my daily life now.‚Äù What will it be like for the family? ‚ÄúWe haven‚Äôt spoken about anything, but I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôll be in the stands, relaxed. They might be nervous, but it‚Äôs a nice reward to play each other in an ATP event, and something we‚Äôve dreamed of, it makes the whole family very proud,‚Äù Francisco said. ‚ÄúHonestly, we‚Äôre not at all stressed. We share a lot, we get on very well and we‚Äôre going to be cracking up laughing. We‚Äôll have fun with one another, and we‚Äôll go out on court to try and compete fairly and the best player will win.‚Äù Did You Know?  The Cer√∫ndolo brothers will be bidding for a place in the quarter-finals in Buenos Aires. It will be their first Lexus ATP Head2Head clash, but their third as professionals. The previous two encounters were taken by Francisco, at the ITF F3 in Villa Maria in 2017 with a 6-2, 6-3 win, and then at the ATP Challenger Tour event in Campinas in 2021, when Francisco won again, 6-1, 7-5 in the quarters. Matches between brothers on the ATP Tour since 2000 Players Tournament Francisco Cerundolo vs. Juan Manuel Cerundolo 2025 Buenos Aires Alexander Zverev d. Mischa Zverev 2018 Washington Gerald Melzer d. Jurgen Melzer 2016¬†Kitzb√ºhel Olivier Rochus d. Christophe Rochus 2000 Palermo & 2002 Wimbledon [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Norrie wins to reach Delray Beach Open last eight
description: British number two Cameron Norrie is through to the quarter-finals of the Delray Beach Open in Florida after beating French fifth seed Arthur Rinderknech.

title: Rybakina 'disappointed' with ex-coach Vukov's ban
description: World number seven Elena Rybakina says she is "disappointed" at the WTA's decision to uphold the ban against her former coach Stefano Vukov following an independent investigation into his behaviour towards the player.

title: Sinner Dominates in One Sided Australian Open Final
description: Jannik Sinner successfully defended his Australian Open title on Sunday, landing his third Grand Slam commandingly with a 6-3, 7-6(4), 6-3 victory over Alexander Zverev. Sinner was ruthless from the baseline and did not face a single break point throughout the two-hour, 42-minute final. The Italian showed his extra firepower from the outset, which has ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan

title: Australian Open 2025 Day 13 Semi Final Recap
description: Jannik Sinner and Alexander Zverev will face off in Sunday‚Äôs 2025 Australian Open final after winning their semi-finals on Friday. Alexander Zverev was the first to move into Sunday‚Äôs showpiece, defeating Novak Djokovic when the Serb retired after losing the first set on a tiebreak. Novak had not hit a tennis ball since his win ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan
